Recorded by the foolish monk Shamon JÅkaku in the summer of the second year of JÅwa, on the twenty-fourth day. The work was completed at the residence of monk Shinsai, the tenth son of ChÅshÅji Temple.

On the third day of the first ten days of the seventh month of the same year, the writing was corrected and proofread. The original was written by HÅzÅin of HÅzÅin. Moreover, in that year, there was a famine in the world and people's strength was weak, but they divided their lives and exerted their meager strength to write and correct with the intention of going to the two wishes. The first is to quickly complete the construction of the temple and continue the Buddha's teachings, and to prolong the long life of wisdom. The second is to be reborn in the inner courtyard, to face the compassionate Honored One, to never turn back in one's mind, and to attain enlightenment.
